head.title: More to Say on 'Pursuit of Less'; Laundry Kept On Going After a Father Died

hedline.hl1: More to Say on 'Pursuit of Less'; Laundry Kept On Going After a Father Died

abstract.p: Antony Wai-Fung Chow letter lauds Andrew Jacobs' August 27 tribute to his late father, Peter Chow, but notes laundry remained opened except for one business day (S) /// 55 NYT 09 17 00 14CY 00015 2 171 I LR 183938 LAUNDRY KEPT ON GOING AFTER A FATHER DIED***Antony Wai-Fung Chow letter lauds Andrew Jacobs' August 27 tribute to his late father, Peter Chow, but notes Queens laundry remained opened, except for one business day, after his death (S)

block.p: The Coping column ''A Patient Life of Sacrifice, Touching Many'' by Andrew Jacobs (Aug. 27) was a wonderful tribute to my late father, Peter Chow.
The Coping column ''A Patient Life of Sacrifice, Touching Many'' by Andrew Jacobs (Aug. 27) was a wonderful tribute to my late father, Peter Chow.

But I want to make it clear that we did not close our laundry for a few days right after his death. Although my father died on a Sunday morning, we closed the business only on the following Friday and Saturday to attend his wake and funeral. My mother felt it would be too disruptive to close the next day, when our neighbors would depend on us for their laundry and dry cleaning needs. We gave advanced notice of the closing instead.
